caption:
This photograph captures a man standing beside large, vertical structures that resemble industrial pipes or architectural columns. The man, wearing what appears to be a uniform with a badge and several pens pocketed on the shirt, is looking up intently at one of the columns. He is wearing a cap, eyeglasses, and has a short haircut. The columns are illuminated softly and uneven shadows are visible on their surfaces, suggesting a dim, perhaps indoor, lighting environment.

The entire scene is bathed in a bluish tone, casting a cool atmosphere over the image. The background is dark and nondescript, focusing all attention on the man and the towering columns beside him. The composition uses a low angle perspective, emphasizing the height of the columns relative to the man, and creating a sense of scale and perhaps awe or contemplation.
title: Closeup of precipitator bags which inflate like vacuum cleaners at the metallurgical furnaces of the Union Carbide ferro-Alloy plant. Total fallout from these furnaces dropped from 52,547 tons annually in 1967 to 824 tons in 1975. Powerplant emissions for the same period decreased from 60,705 to 1,825 tons annually. A compliance schedule was reached between the corporation and the West Virginia Air Pollution Control Commission. (See fiche #141 to 146)
